channel.title: Cherokee RS2 Scripts
channel.description:
they are differant from normal cherokee scripts
iv made a few scripts for the test applet, but when i try them on runescape, suddenly i get a null pointer exception
normal scripts uses the class 'AccessorMethods', but there is a class called 'RS2AccessorMethods', im assuming you have to use that instead of the other one for RS2 scripts
however, you cant put RS2AccessorMethods into void start() because its an abstract method and you have to override the one with AccessorMethods as a parameter
can someone tell me how to do it? or post a quick RS2 cherokee script source?
ps. Cherokee is a scriptable java silent mouse which works for all applets, you can get it [url=http://sourceforge.net/projects/cherokee/index.php]Here[/url]
pps. hey mopar, why not make a topic about here somewhere, like you did with SIDE

item.title: Cherokee RS2 Scripts

item.description:
@killer-christian wrote:

thanks pwnd for the advice!

Read full topic

item.title: Cherokee RS2 Scripts
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Silver Lining:

RS2AccessorMethods returns null for most of the methods. You’ll need to modify it to return something useful.

He is correct, you have to write your own AccessorMethods because I haven’t got around to doing it yet.

Read full topic

item.description:
@yakman wrote:

they are differant from normal cherokee scripts

iv made a few scripts for the test applet, but when i try them on runescape, suddenly i get a null pointer exception

normal scripts uses the class ‘AccessorMethods’, but there is a class called ‘RS2AccessorMethods’, im assuming you have to use that instead of the other one for RS2 scripts

however, you cant put RS2AccessorMethods into void start() because its an abstract method and you have to override the one with AccessorMethods as a parameter

can someone tell me how to do it? or post a quick RS2 cherokee script source?

ps. Cherokee is a scriptable java silent mouse which works for all applets, you can get it Here
